column4: hi, is it normal for VirtualBox to take ages to install an OS from disc? I'm only 3% of the way through an installation of PCBSD9 and it seems to be dragging on inordinately. I did select a lot of packages but, I think there should have been more progress than this.
did you MD5 test the ISO too?
nope, I downloaded it from their mirror and burned it to a disc without doing any checks. I don't think there's anything wrong with the image as such.
then how did you know the ISO was complete and consistent?
good point but tbh I've never burnt an image from there or ubuntu or debian that wasn't working perfectly.
if you don't use torrents, the data needs to be checked so you know the data isn't damaged
I'd give it a while but I'd check the ISO
I'll keep that in mind, once this installation completes/falls over.
is that a fps of some sort?
it is, is counterstrike like but based on the unreal engine :)
sounds like good fun. Will it work well on an old athlon x2 with an Nvidia GT400 gfx card?
runs well on my GF6150LE onboard
with single core sempron am2 @ 1.6Ghz and 2Gb DDR2
did you check if it was cmpatible on the virtualbox website?
nope, I checked in the help files within VirtualBox
i suggest you check stuff before takinbg on projects, as wel as test ISOs
